Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night”
Reviews.Author: decoydonna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night while on our way to Sedona. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast was typical Fairfield breakfast. We sat by the pool to have our coffee. The staff were very friendly. This hotel is fine if you need to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: BIGtraveller66
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night here to catch an early flight. Hotel is an older property, with not much nearby in terms of dining etc. We had to take a taxi to another exit to have diner. We did not experience breakfast. Rooms, halls and general hotel area was clean. Only concern was the black mold all over our ceiling in the bathroom however, we did notice a sign when as we were leaving that the hotel will undergo extensive refurbishment of the rooms (well needed!). Great for one night. Shuttle to airport was very good, driver very friendly and on time. Wish they could shuttle to nearby restaurants as we did nto have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel b/c we had a coupon for it. I seen other reviewers said it was outdated however I seen nothing wrong. Everyone was very friendly and had a great breakfast the next morning. Even tho we were close to the air port there was very little noise I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to PHX Airport -- Average Property At Best”
Reviews.Author: Margie R.
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Fairfield Inn - Phoenix Airport on March 9, 2012 while waiting to fly out on March 10. The best feature of this Fairfield Inn: very convenient to the airport. Shuttle runs back and forth every half hour. On the negative side: the hotel could use some updating -- looked a bit "worn"; but overall still appeared to be clean. Room was small with a very noisy fan for heat or air. (We shut it off.) And a very small pool is located in front of the hotel. Breakfast was OK -- the typical fare of hot and cold items, fruit, etc. Nothing close by as far as dining or shopping. Satisfied our need of wanting to stay close to the airport, but a little disappointed for a Fairfield Inn. A one-night stay is about all you'd want here.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: redsoxnation949
Reviews.Content: just needed a place to stay near the airport so thought this would be fine, however, this was not up to par with the other fairfield inns I have stayed in. I would pass on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Aging but well maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: rew345
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located close to airport and freeways. Easy access from all around Phoenix.. I was attending Barrett Jackson in Scottsdale. The ride was only 30min, the Hotel was convenient for me for its pricing and location. Around the hotel there is not much to see or to dine out, though within 10 min of drive you have a lot of shopping centers. Basically you need a car to get around. Rooms have Wifi access, it works perfectly. The breakfast is good but very basic. A couple of microwave sandwiches, canned fruits and so on.: the basic staff. Personally I liked the breakfast but for a "lady" it is not a romantic place to start the morning. The hotel price includes both breakfast and wifi access. My room 325 was clean, the furniture is aging, the plasma TV runs 10/10, the bathroom is small but clean. The bed was comfortable though I didn't like the pillows. The hotel staff was professional and friendly. This hotel is likely the oldest Marriott hotel; however it is very decent if you are on limited budget. I recommend this hotel for 1-3 nights stay if you don't plan to remain long time during the day at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Like it!”
Reviews.Author: DMarieA
Reviews.Content: With lots of stress involved in family issues, this was a great place for us to stay as a home base for taking care of details. Friendly staff and wonderful breakfast with numerous choices and no pressure or hurry. Front desk peeps were always friendly and more than willing to help us find our way around the city. Pool was being re-furbished at the time, but never an issue of workers while we were there. Great prices off season.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: gksandiego
Reviews.Content: I came to Phoenix for a conference, I stayed at the conference hotel (35-45 min away) for the first 2 nights, but with an early morning flight home, I chose to stay closer to the airport the last night. The Fairfield Inn was a short 5 min drive to the car rental facility which was very convenient for an early flight. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, free boarding pass printing and basic but convenient continental breakfast. If staying in Phoenix again with an early morning flight, I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good for an Overnight Prior to an Early Morning Flight”
Reviews.Author: Steve1362
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel overnight on our return from the Grand Canyon to catch an early morning flight. Everything at this hotel was fairly plain and non-descript but our two queen room was clean and comfortable even if it was a bit tight. The front desk staff was friendly and welcoming. The morning breakfast was like plain but suitable. The best part is the location near the airport and the reasonable rate. I would stay here again for an overnight to catch a flight but probably not for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room I have Ever Had in a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TSchenk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the night before returning home from a business conference. This was without a doubt the smallest, most cramped room I have ever had in any hotel. We picked up a couple of foot long subs on the way here and ended up having to eat them on the edge of the bed because there was no room for two people to sit comfortably anywhere else. That is unless you wanted to sit on the floor by the front door. On a positive note, the staff member who checked us in was very friendly and professional. The entire hotel was very clean and well maintained. There was complimentary wireless internet that worked well. The one feature I liked very much was the multimedia interface box that allowed me to connect my laptop to the 32 inch flat panel television. I wish all premium hotels offered this device. We left too early to try the free breakfast so I cannot comment its quality, but the eating area appeared clean. My wife, who made this reservation, is a Gold member of the Marriot Rewards program. If we were given a room this ridiculously small with Gold status, I can only guess how bad it is for regular guests. We stayed in the Marriot Residence Inn on 44th street the night we arrived and for only $10 more we had a full kitchen, living area and separate bed/bath area. I will definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone. I have had larger rooms in hotels in Cambodia, Nepal and Thailand.

Reviews.Title: “Hospital or prison corridors....”
Reviews.Author: WalterStephen
Reviews.Content: is what it looked like going to our rooms from the drab lobby. When we checked in, the girl who was behind the computer was kind enough to offer us an upgraded room. However, the attendant at the next computer told her that we were not entitled to a king size bed. This is the first time in all the years we're stayed in a Marriott that we were treated like that. Then to add insult to injury, when we returned to our room the following day at 4:30 PM, our room had not been serviced by housekeeping. The excuse was that they had hired 3 new people in that department and the front desk girl said to me, "What do you expect me to do about your room." When my wife took our face towels and wash cloths to the front desk to get clean ones, the front desk people could find only one wash cloth and two hand towels for us. Can you imagine that no one in the hotel at 5 PM had a key to the linen closet? There are enough other hotels near the Phoenix airport. If you stay at this one and the experience is like ours, you can't say you were not warned. The rooms and bathrooms are old and drab, but the breakfast was good and the AC worked well. But the front desk people have a terrible attitude and we're were very patient and blown away. Have a nice holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you just need to lay your head down.”
Reviews.Author: SandraBoston
Reviews.Content: I booked this place at $78.00 because my flight into Phoenix was late night. Fine if you just need to sleep. The hotel was clean but older style. Needs updating but fine for a quick stay. I was travelling solo and the parking lot was very dark and the area was a little sketchy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for flying out, helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: GRfamily49506
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before departing from PHX. Jake, the front desk rep, was very friendly and offered helpful tips and good directions for car rental return procedure and dining options. Breakfast was plentiful and offered in a comfortable and clean area. Room was very spacious, clean and quiet. The pool area was OK although the pool itself needs care: leaves floating on the surface and sand at the bottom. The shuttle drivers were courteous and helpful. Overall great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Just a layover”
Reviews.Author: johnschmitt1964
Reviews.Content: I had a 8 hour lay over in PHX, and did not want to spend it at the airport. The shuttle picked me up quickly and i was able to check in at about 10 am, This was prearranged. The room was clean and quite, I was able to get a nap in and then some homework done on the computer, Good Internet service. The young blonde man working the desk on the Evening of Aug 7, was attentive and polite. The shuttle going back to the airport took a while to arrive but I still had time to get on my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Greagt for overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: worldseeker52
Reviews.Content: Needed hotel for over night stay before flying back to east coast, so this was perfect for us. We just needed a room with a good rate. They will be renovating soon, so the hotel will be upgraded. They do have a shuttle to the airport. Breakfast was good and had variety. To find restaurants, when leaving the hotel, make a left and drive for about 10 min and you will find many choices.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Grace........I slept like a babe”
Reviews.Author: cathygSpokane_Wa
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel......the rooms were clean, service was great and the beds were the best I have slept on in months. The front desk personnel were amazingly helpful and friendly. Other staff were as well. I would definitely go there again if I flew into Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Park, Stay and Fly”
Reviews.Author: laurae
Reviews.Content: We utilized this hotel as a park, Stay and Fly for our 10 day vacation. We arrived about 3pm and were promptly greeted by the front desk staff. The lobby is small but well appointed for such a small hotel. The desk staff gave my child a coloring book. We got our room keys and a registration for our car, which would remain in the lot and scheduled our shuttle to the airport and took one of the luggage trolly (They have several by the front door) and got our luggage. Our room was 2 double beds. Nothing really special, but clean and comfortable. We utilized the free wireless. For dinner, we went to a Steakhouse called Rustler's Rooste, where our child was able to Slide into the dinning room. It was a nice dinner and we would go back. When we returned we parked our car in the back of the hotel where they told us. It seemed perfectly safe there and we noticed many security camera in the parking lot. Breakfast on the morning was very simple, but it was okay... If I remember correctly... Microwave breakfast sandwich, Cereals, yogurts, Fruit and Waffles. Coffee, tea, hot Chocolate, Milk and Juice. Also seemed to have Coffee available all day, which was nice. The breakfast room is small, maybe only 10 tables, but most people don't linger. They have a TV in the room as well. The shuttle was prompt and got us to the airport in less than 10 minutes. Pick up was easy, we just found a hotel phone at the airport near baggage claim and they told us where to meet and then once they picked up up, we got our car and were on our way. No issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for travelers needing a no-frills hotel for a night”
Reviews.Author: Gelf89
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Phoenix Airport early evening and were looking for an affordable hotel near the airport and interstate. The Fairfield Inn fit the bill and did not disappoint. We were checked in very quickly by friendly desk staff. We were also given directions to nearby restaurants (a car helps, as there's only a Denny's within walking distance--not that walking this road is recommended, but it can be done). The hotel is about 10-15 minutes from Arizona State and numerous restaurants. The Denny's served us well when looking for a place to eat at 5 am the next morning. The room is your standard Fairfield Inn. It was clean, but nothing exceptional. The breakfast area at the hotel didn't look too promising. We were on the road before the spread was put out in the morning, so we can't say too much about it. I wouldn't expect anything beyond pre-packaged muffins and the basics, though. The area is not very touristy, but has a bunch of hotels. We had no problems parking in front of the hotel. For the price, it was a great deal for an overnight "just passing through town" stay.

Reviews.Title: “They lure you in with a Roomsaver-coupon.....”
Reviews.Author: lelici49
Reviews.Content: I found a coupon on roomsaver for 54$ a night, which was a great rate since the rooms are 129$ regular price. At the lobby i asked if there were any king rooms available for 4 nights, and the answer was a quick yes. Then i showed her my Roomsaver-coupon, and i saw by the look on her face that she wasn't too happy with it. After a brief thinking periode, she said she could only give me the 54$ rate the 1st night, the other 3 nights i had to pay 129$. I asked why. "Because the other days we are above the 80% occupancy" was the answer, which i found very hard to believe, since this was a wednesday, and there were hardly any cars at the parking. So i went to another hotel were i met a German couple who were looking for a hotel close to the airport, and i handed them the coupon and the info i gathered at the Fairfield. They went to the hotel on Saturday and handed the coupon. Surprise, surprise; they got the same comment as we got. First night only with the coupon....eh, Saturday would have been in my 4 nights....?????!!!!! I planned to stay at 4 other Fairfields during my roadtrip in the US, but after this scam, i skipped all of them. Never again a Fairfield Inn for us, thank you very much!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for airport convenience”
Reviews.Author: Lindo07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew to Arizona for a long weekend to visit the Grand Canyon and other parks in the northern part of the state. We arrived in Phoenix rather late and had a very early flight on the return, so wanted to stay near the airport on either end of the trip. We selected the Fairfield because of its proximity to the airport, the complimentary shuttle and, of course(!), Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel staff were all very nice (Jake and Jenny at the front desk, and Mark and Tim driving the shuttle). The room and the property were clean, the bed was very comfortable, and overall it was very quiet. However, if you're looking for a lively atmosphere, then Tempe, home of Arizona State University, is only 3 miles away. There were also plenty of restaurants there, as well. Unfortunately, if you don't have a car (as we didn't at the end of our trip since we'd turned it back in), your choices are limited, which could be a negative. However, the shuttle drivers, even though it's not advertised and I doubt you could demand this service, were kind enough to drive us the three miles, which worked out great. In short, for a clean, quiet and convenient place that's close to Sky Harbor International, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice near Airport”
Reviews.Author: mal080
Reviews.Content: If you want a reasonably priced hotel near the airport, this would be a good choice. It has everything one might want except maybe a restaurant. The room was a decent size, clean, the bed was comfortable (nice down pillows) & no plane noise whatsoever. It is on a busy street, which our room faced, but we were not disturbed by traffic. The free internet was good. The breakfast has lots to choose from & is replenished regularly. There are several restaurants close by, there is a small pool (fine for kids). Car rental return is about 5 min. away & easy to find from the hotel. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay for Spring Training”
Reviews.Author: ntz4bbl
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at the Fairfield Inn Phoenix Airport. Our visit was to attend a couple of Angels Spring Training Games. The hotel was only about 5 minutes from the stadium. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was much more than an ordinary continental breakfast. There were egg sandwiches, waffles, cereal, hard boiled eggs, lots of breads and pastries, juice, and coffee. It was a bit light on fruit. But, that is really a minor complaint. We checked out the pool for an hour or so. Very small, but at least they had one. The room was very comfortable, the Internet was easy to access and included in the room rate. Yes, we will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Convience.”
Reviews.Author: Geri1946
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place too stay a night or two before heading out to the sites of Sedona and surrounding areas. Downtown was great.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Quality and Service at a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Hiker30
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 different times for a total of 6 nights (most recently late Dec 2009). I've paid around $70 per night each time, and I feel like I've gotten good value for my money. This is a consistent, reliable choice for staying near the airport in Phoenix. The hotel has a courtesy shuttle. The location is easy to access, lots of good restaurant choices nearby and the hotel provides you with a map of these options ('Mucho Gusto' is my favorite). Rooms are quiet, clean, and in good condition, with good quality in-wall heating/AC units. The mattresses are comfortable, the hotel provides both foam and down pillows. The tvs are tube-type. Breakfast is ok---hard-boiled eggs, microwave egg-sandwiches, juices, some fruit, yogurt, etc. Just an FYI, upper floor rooms have insanely high ceilings (like 15 feet, maybe more), presumably to help alleviate the desert heat.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, up to chain standards”
Reviews.Author: traveltourtrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here instead of our usual Courtyard by Marriott, and it worked out pretty well. Pretty much met the usual, Fairfield By Marriott standard. Hotel was very quiet, room was clean, and as you might expect for the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close To Airport”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaNightryder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the night so we could catch an early Sunday morning flight. The property was clean and the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. It is within 10 minutes of the rental car return and the Airport and located within a business area and not far from area eateries. Clean and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Suited Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: Gizmocub
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the close proximity to the airport. We arrived late on a Saturday and after a ten and a half hour flight just wanted a comfortable place to sleep. I didn't have particularly high expectations, so I was pleasantly surprised. Check in was quick and friendly. Although it has to be said that the lift is small and the corridors narrow and dark and this makes the place feels dated, the room itself was clean, the bed was comfortable, with obviously new linens. A good sized refrigerator was provided and a coffee maker. We weren't disturbed by any plane noise. The complimentary breakfast offered a reasonable choice, although some fresh fruit would have been a nice addition. We liked the fact that breakfast was available early as this gave us the chance for an early start the following morning. The front desk were very friendly when we checked out and gave us clear, concise driving directions to get us out of the city. All in all it suited our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place when you're flying out early”
Reviews.Author: FTAListCom
Reviews.Content: This Fairfield feels a little old, but it was everything we needed to catch an early morning flight. Breakfast (beginning at 6 am weekdays) included microwavable morning sandwiches as well as the colder usual suspects. They had a stack of sheets with easy directions to the car rental return, including where to stop for gas. The room felt just a little small. It had a good-sized refrigerator, and its TV had a fair selection of cable channels along with PPV movies. We zapped some popcorn in the microwave in the breakfast area. I was amazed that cans of soda were available for 75 cents from the vending machines; don't they know they're supposed to overcharge? There wasn't anything wrong with our stay, but I just never felt that five-star feeling while I was here. It was perfect for what we needed: a place to help us get to the airport on time.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and restful”
Reviews.Author: Rosementko
Reviews.Content: We (my husband and I) chose this hotel because it was close to the airport and there was free shuttle service to the airport. We stayed at the hotel on a Saturday night and had an early Sunday morning flight to catch. The reason that we were in Phoenix was to spend the Thanksgiving holiday with family. I booked directly with the hotel and received a better rate than what was offered on various websites. When I asked the reservation person for an AARP discount, she said they didn't have one, but she would extend the AAA discount. A bargain! The shuttle picked us up at the airport after we returned our rental car. The wait for the shuttle was short, and the driver was courteous and friendly. Check-in was fast. Our room was clean and modern. There was adequate space for our suitcases and we even had a little mini fridge. There was plenty of room to spread out. The room was on the first floor and was very quiet. The hotel has a guest laundry room. We had a bunch of dirty clothes so I ran a load. The machines were coin operated, but the price was reasonable and the hotel provided the laundry soap and dryer sheets. The laundry room was clean too. I stopped by the front desk several times for little things like a stapler, change for the laundry, some tape, drop off some letters for mailing, ask about location of a drug store, ask for an envelope to put all of my receipts in. I always received a smile and a helpful response. We stopped by the front desk and inquired about dining options. The desk clerk gave us a list of recommended restaurants and let us know that the shuttle driver could drop us off on Mill Street in Tempe so we could eat at one of the restaurants in that area. We took her advice and had a great dinner at a Greek restaurant. We called the driver when we finished dinner and she arrived in five minutes at a prearranged pickup area. We asked for a wake up call and received it. We were up too early to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast so we do not know what we missed. We rode the shuttle to the airport for our early flight. Everything was smooth and everyone was great. All in all this was a good experience. We would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to everyone. Oh, yeah - cookies. They make cookies every evening. Mmmm. They were good too. My husband says that this place is first class.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: CaptainPlanIt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Phoenix airport Fairfield the first night of a week long vacation. We worked a half day, drove to our east coast airport and flew across country, arriving at 9 pm local time and 11 pm to our bodies. We were tired and all we wanted to do was sleep. We called the hotel from the courtesy phone in baggage claim and although we had some trouble getting someone to answer, when they did they told us the courtesy shuttle was right outside the door - and it was. How great is that? The driver offered us "free bottled water" from a cooler in the front seat, also very nice. The ride to the hotel was short and painless, as was check in, and in mere minutes we were sound asleep in the comfortable bed. If I was a really light sleeper I might be bothered by planes taking off and landing at this hotel, as we would occassionally hear the dull roar of a plane passing by overhead. But we did not need to turn the heat or air on, and I imagine if we had, any sound from the unit would have been greater than that of the planes. If I was a really light sleeper this hotel might not have been the best choice. We woke up early, our bodies still being on east coast time, and enjoyed getting in the outside hot tub. Unlike a lot of other hotels, the pool and hot tub here are open 24 hours. We had a cup of coffee while soaking, watching the sky brighten. It was a good way to start the day. Breakfast was the standard Fairfield fare, with Jimmy Dean frozen breakfast sandwiches to microwave, cereals, muffins and some fruit. The girls restocking the selections were friendly and efficient. We took the hotel shuttle back to the airport to go get a rental car, and the driver took us directly to a line of rental car shuttle busses, we hopped out of the one we were in, onto another and away we went. Painless. My only complaint with Fairfields is the lack of counter space by the sink in the bath. We had about seven square inches, hardly enough room to even set down one toiletry kit let alone two, and not near enough room to unpack. This is an issue I've seen at several Fairfield's, not just at the Phoenix airport, so it is system wide and not this property. All in all we had an entirely satisfactory experience at the Phoenix airport Fairfield, and I would gladly stay here again should our travel plans cause us to stay overnight near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “MANAGEMENT NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: photoguyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My friend reserved two rooms for our overnight before flying out of Phoenix. When we arrived we asked the clerk to charge one of the rooms to my credit card and the other to my friend's card. This was evidently a "rocket science" request for as a result the following occurred: 1. I was billed twice for the same room for the same day 2. I had to call the hotel four times in one day since the voice mail I was given was for someone not at work that day to fix the billing. 3. A security guard knocked on our door at 2:30 am the day of our departure asking for a receipt he was told to collect as the wrong receipt for identical price rooms was switched by them at the desk. 4. Their website states that they have shuttle service to the airport. The problem is that it starts at 6:00 am so forget about making a morning flight and using their shuttle. Answer from the manager was " Well, we didn't say 24 Hr. shuttle service". I guess this is another thing the savvy traveler will have to ask about....live and learn. 5. My friend was billed for her room and a more expensive room for the same day. Another double charge problem....with the added insult of a higher price. 6. The hotel alleges that they didn't have my friend's credit card numbers but how I asked could the erroneous billing show up on her credit card statement? 7. The room was neat and clean but this was the most mismanaged hotel I have ever been in. I was offered an "I'm sorry", however this chain of ineptness was all too similar to a Marx Brothers "Night at the Opera".

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at the Fairfield INn”
Reviews.Author: Frenchie22
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel after a long flight. The beds were really comfortable. We were absolutely not bothered by the planes landing and taking off nearby. The staff was especially friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Dunderlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night when we arrived in Phoenix from the UK and this hotel was exactly what we needed - clean, comfortable, decent size room, great bed and close to the airport. Breakfast was nothing fancy but was better than average for a free continental buffet. Even if we'd been staying in Phoenix for a longer stay I would have been quite happy to have this as our base. The only downside for a longer stay might be the distance from any decent eating places. We just wanted to grab a quick bite before going to bed(as it was about 3am according to our body clocks by the time we checked in) so drove a couple of miles down the road to a Burger King. There certainly didn't seem to be anything you could easily walk to. It was not a boutique hotel or friendly B&B and didn't have much character, plus the setting wasn't particularly interesting or pretty - but that wasn't what we needed nor wanted to pay for. I think it was excellent value for money as the quality of the accomodation was better than I thought we'd get for the price - which is why I'm giving it a rating of four and not a three (i.e. in my view it was above average for this price range). One final thing - despite being so close to the airport we didn't hear a single plane while we were there (although we were VERY tired so may have slept through it!)

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect and more”
Reviews.Author: pitachu
Reviews.Content: I can't add much to what has already been said, but I can reiterate it. Like most people here we stayed one night after arriving from Ireland late and before heading to the Grand Canyon the next day. The hotel gave us everything we needed, it is close to the airport and there are number of places to eat near by (the front desk provided us with a map to them all). We picked our car up up the night we arrived and this hotel is close enough to the car rental center at Phoenix Sky Harbor that the drive was manageable after 12 hours traveling. I have however driven the in the States before; it would also be just as convenient to pick the car up the next day. The breakfast was a self service, all you can eat affair, again just what we needed - home made waffles were great. You can really fill up before heading off. Overall a great start to any adventure :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for stopover”
Reviews.Author: cheshirelass44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night during flights from Europe to Hawaii. Hotel exceeded expectations - room spacious with comfortable beds, free shuttle service to/from airport was timely and courteous. Complimentary breakfast (with make your own wafffles!) was good, and better than many continental breakfasts I've had to pay for. Computer with free internet access was a bonus (and something for which we had to pay dearly at other locations). Only downside was lack of restaurant on site - however a local pizza delivery service sufficed. Excellent value for money and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Prcatical, with very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: dooleke
Reviews.Content: One word-Practical! Excellent service too as my family arrived after midnight from east coast frazzled and tired as our luggage did not arrive. We were on a one-night stay prior to going to Sedona/GCNP. Front desk staff worked quickly getting us the usual needs including contact lense solution and made us much more relaxed, even through in a goody bag to boot. Hotel is clean, beds top notch and it's an easy check-in/out process. Free breakfast (waffle iron etc) was practical too. On our return to Phx a week later from Grand Canyon, we stayed one night at the stuffy overpriced, gargantuan (spelling??) JW Marriott Desert Ridge. Don't bother going there. The airport Farfield is very nice. Would stay again. Thanks Tracy and front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice..........Great Breakfast..........Comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: 2kids2cats
Reviews.Content: A great place, just like we've come to expect of Fairfield Inns. We don't travel a lot, but have come to enjoy Fairfield Inns when we do. We arrived at 2:30am, after being on the road about 12 hours on our way to the Grand Canyon. Our room was very clean, except just a couple of hairs in the bathroom. I understand hair is hard to get 100% cleaned up. I'm picky about hotel rooms, in fact, I bring Lysol wipes. The bed linen looked new. The beds were very comfy, and helped up get a much needed good night's sleep. My teenaged son loved the free in-room wi-fi. We needed more towels and bathrags, so I went to the lobby to ask for them. The clerk handed them to me on the spot so we didn't have to wait for them to be delivered. I could go on and on about the breakfast. 3 or 4 juices, water, coffee, hot and cold cereal, donuts (not a great selection), boiled eggs, yogurt, bagels and cream cheese, but the BEST was waffles. They already have the batter mixed up and in cups. You just pour it in the waffle maker, read the directions, and 2 minutes later you have delicious waffles. YUMMY!!! One bit of advice; you don't need to pour the whole cup into the waffle maker, but I learned it the messy way. I'd definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the Phoenix area. They are very close to I-10.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: rogerslade
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable rooms, adequate breakfast & free shuttle toand from airport. All you could want from an airport hotel. If you arrive late save a day's car hire by overnighting here.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid place for a 1 or 2 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: David3614
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel near the airport because we reserved a rental car for tomorrow. My kids are 12 and 10, and I didn't want to make them go on a big drive when to us, it felt like 11:00. We took the bus to the hotel, which went very smoothly. The staff was very caring and kind. The beds were comfortable, but we requested foam pillows, and when we called the lobby, they were out. Otherwise, the room was very clean and very nice. The outdoor pool and jacuzzi was really, really fun. The pool was warm(!!!), and the jacuzzi wasn't extremely hot, it felt like my shower temperature. The scenery was pretty outside, where there were exotic trees that were worth pictures. Overall, everything except pillow stock was tremendous!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: insurance209
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and LOVED it! The breakfast each morning is better than any other "free" continental breakfast I have had at other hotels. The staff was wonderful! The room was very clean!! We actually booked them for one more night on the same trip because we liked it so much. Our room was next to the elevator and you couldn't even hear it from our room! I was very surprised how much I liked this hotel. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: BabyBoomerCumbria
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night having flown in from England. Just needed a quiet, comfortable hotel to crash out in and this place delivered. Good welcome, very clean, comfortable rooms. Not luxurious, but excellent value at around £40 for the night. Good little breakfast buffet in the morning included. Used the shuttle service both to and from the airport - absolutely efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZWiseguy
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to add my comments to the list of accolades for the Fairfield Inn by Sky Harbor airport. The service was excellent all around, including friendly people at the front desk, prompt and polite shuttle drivers, and an efficient cleaning staff. The rates were wonderful - $75 a night before tax, about $83 with tax. The Park and Fly option costs an additional $20, but you can leave your car up to 14 days. Compare that to the $8/day economy lot and it makes sense to drop your car there if you are traveling more than 3 days. The hotel nearly has a direct highway to the airport and it takes the shuttle less than 5 minutes to get there. I stayed one night before flying out, and then when I came back decided to stay another night and relax. I will stay here again if I am flying out of PHX.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: taffy2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after flying into PHX late. The staff was pleasant and the rooms and common areas were clean. Our room was a little stuffy when we walked in so we cranked on the a/c and within 10 minutes it was perfect. And the a/c was very powerful as we ended up having to shut it off because it cooled the room so quickly. The breakfast was nice. There were waffles, cereals, bagels, donuts and some fruit... a typical continental breakfast. The only complaint I had was the parking. Since we arrived so late, there was not much space left... I wouldn't want to get in late on a night the hotel was really busy.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyCt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Memorial Day evening, awaiting an early morning flight on Tuesday. Not sure if they were having a special, but our king-sized bedded room was less than $60, with AAA discount.! The front desk attendant was very helpful and friendly, room was very clean, nice sheets and comfortable bed. We left too early to have the included breakfast, but they did apparently have coffee all the time. I can say the vending machines were well stocked. We choose this hotel particularly for the complimentary 24 hr shuttle to the airport. (we had no car) The front desk person made the arrangements upon check-in, setup the wakeup call and made suggestions on where to eat, or order in. (We chose to get a pizza delivered). Took a dip in the pool while waiting for delivery- they even had lots of nice clean folded towels available to use and leave in the pool area. Just could not have been more pleased, especially at that price!!

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lmg915
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff was wonderful. We went to Arizona for a week and stayed in 2 other Marriott hotels. I picked each hotel out through Trip Advisor. They were all wonderful. We planned on staying here one night after landing at Phoenix Airport. After 2hrs of being there we deceided to book the night before we planned to leave to return home the following week. They gave us an excellent price for the night we booked to come back. Breakfast was great. Clean rooms. Wonderful staff!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Regular hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's just a standard hotel. Except, we had asked for a suite and the staff said that the room we received was a suite. The room was just slightly bigger than the standard room. The roof was extremely high though. They could've built a whole other floor with the space.
